newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real rises 0.19 pct on dollar inflows.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real rises 0.19 pct on dollar inflows.

text.p: Brazil's real rose 0.19 percent to close at 1.0590 per dollar on dollar inflows in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
Preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed a Tuesday surplus of $75 million. On Monday, net dollar flows posted an $55.5 million surplus.
In the interbank foreign exchange floating rate market, the real dropped 0.06 percent to end at 1.0631 per dollar, traders said.
In the illegal parallel market, the real fell 0.44 percent to close at 1.145 per dollar.
